question: Jason watches TV after he finishes his homework every night. On Tuesday and Wednesday, he watched a 1-hour episode of his favorite show each night. On Thursday, he watched a few episodes of a 30-minute show. On Friday, he finished homework early and watched a 6-hour episode and a 45-minute show. On Saturday, he got to stay up late, so he watched four 5-hour episodes. If he watched 30 hours of TV in all, how many 30-minute episodes did he watch on Thursday?
answer:
Let E be the number of episodes he watched on Thursday.
After Tuesday, he had 30 - 1 = <<30-1=29>>29 hours of TV left.
After Wednesday, he had 29 - 1 = <<29-1=28>>28 hours of TV left.
After Friday, he had 28 - 6 - 0.75 = 21.25 hours of TV left.
After Saturday, he had 21.25 - 20 = 1.25 hours of TV left.
Each 30-minute episode is 1/2 hour.
Thus, E = 1.25/0.5 = 2.5 episodes.
#### 2.5
